data.text: @NeuroFidelity @tdverstynen @fmrib_steve yeah, it's def. challenging to optimize for multiple goals and there are trade-offs. One in-between suggestion, take the preprocessed data and renormalize, so add additional steps to the end of your standardized pipeline to optimize for additional questions.

@vdcalhoun @tdverstynen @fmrib_steve The processing pipeline (which was developed when there was no prospect of longitudinal data) treats every imaging session in isolation. Since we built the pipeline for the whole research community, we want our results to be consistent and reproducible, so we did not change it.

@NeuroFidelity @tdverstynen @fmrib_steve Did you use a longitudinal pipeline (each individual jointly optimized across time)? Or were all timepoints treated independently wrt spatial normalization? There is no perfect solution here of course.

@tdverstynen @KordingLab Interestingly we did find some similar regions in our CT SBM/VBM study (caveats: much smaller, not longitudinal, and only in hospitalized but with clinical outcomes).  https://t.co/WCLxfo9Ejg

@fmrib_steve @NeuroFidelity Interesting. Thanks!
